formattedAddress: 340 W Broadway, New York, NY 10013, USA
adrFormatAddress: 340 W Broadway, New York, NY 10013, USA

editorialSummary.text: French bistro classics draw SoHo shoppers to this spot with huge windows that open onto the street.

originalText.text: I have never been so poorly served in a restaurant in my life! When it was time to pay the bill, I added the amount of the tip, 20%, with my food bill so I could pay everything together.I paid, and the manager came to the table with the receipt and asked for the tip, I told him that I had added on the bill, when he heard me saying that, he freaked out! He said I had to do it later and not at that time because he wouldn't gain anything! I was with my young children and we heard a lot of insults and swearing. We don't live here, we are visitors and we don't know how it works. My children were very scared by the way we were treated. I simply had no reaction.

We don't live here, we are visitors and we don't know how it works. My children were very scared by the way we were treated. I simply had no reaction.

originalText.text:
Very crowded every weekend!

Good spot to have brunch and hang out! The staff were nice and helpful . They were very entertaining. This place is very popping nowadays. Every time I went or walk by ,there are lines in front of the restaurant especially summer time .

Luckily last time I went my friend and I got the table from a walk in .

Good spot for day party

originalText.text: This is a great place for people watching even now during COVID.  Street is busy with people.  Service was friendly.  Casual and laid back vibe with music in the background.  Oysters were surprisingly good.  East coast oysters.  Mussels were just ok. A little overcooked.  The steak was ok but seemed like it was cook over something before cleaning the grill.  Just seemed like there was a flavor different than the meat.  This is more for a good neighborhood soho restaurant for being in the “scene” but food was just okay.  Wine was good.  Bread was ok.  Bottomless water :)

originalText.text:
Super fun and bumping brunch joint! The food had a nice French touch to it and the overall ambience and atmosphere is great.

Food was surprisingly just mediocre to us. Nothing was super outstanding or memorable… but overall it was a fantastic meal and the drinks are great.

text.text:

Food was surprisingly just mediocre to us. Nothing was super outstanding or memorable… but overall it was a fantastic meal and the drinks are great.

originalText.text: Don’t come here - especially for a special occasion. Came here for a group of 10 for my friends birthday. our server basically threw a temper tantrum when we wanted to eat family style claiming we didn’t order enough food even though we all had drinks on top of our shared plates. He them added additional orders of the food that we ordered. Then one of us asked if they do anything for birthdays he said yes and proceeded to charge us for a chocolate mousse. If you’re going to charge for the birthday dessert at least let them order which one they want? when we confronted him about not ordering the mousse he had another temper tantrum pointing and yelling at the girl who asked if they do anything for desserts. He then also tipped himself 20% even though they don’t state anywhere that they add automatic gratuity. The food was okay but extremely overpriced.
